title: Drawing, "Project for a water kettle with stand", 1820–30
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and gray, black wash, graphite on wove paper
signed: Signed in black ink, lower right: J. Seethaler
inscribed: Inscribed in reddish ink, lower right corner: N 4 [cut off, illegible]
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: Kettle shown from side view; spout at left. Upper and lower parts of body surrounded with calyxes; leaf band along inner rim of the upper section. One end of asymmetrical handle is fastened to body lower than the other, ending in a snake's forepart. Stand with a receptacle for spirits.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Project for a water kettle with stand", 1820–30.
1820–30. Pen and black ink, brush and gray, black wash, graphite on wove paper. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1911-28-316.
